methods.Synopsis: Return summary info about electronic FEC filings

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. Default is json.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return. Default is 1.

parameters.Name: page_size
parameters.Description: The number of page results to return. for json, the default is 100 and the maximum is 100. This parameter is ignored for csv downloads, which return all matching rows, with a limit of 2000 total rows returned.

parameters.Name: candidate_id
parameters.Description: The FEC's id for the candidate connected to this committee. Only authorized committees are connected to candidates; leadership pacs are unconnected.

parameters.Name: committee_class
parameters.Description: The one letter code that describes the type of committee (see the committee reference above). Multiple committee types are allowed--a search for house and senate candidate committees would use HS, for instance.

parameters.Name: min_coh
parameters.Description: The minimum cash on hand of a report to include. Not all electronic reports include a cash on hand, so using this option will exclude all of those that do not report this figure.

parameters.Name: min_raised
parameters.Description: The minimum money raised. Not all electronic reports include an amount raised, so using this option will exclude all of those that do not report this figure.

parameters.Name: min_spent
parameters.Description: The minimum money spent. Not all electronic reports include an amount spent, so using this option will exclude all of those that do not report this figure.

parameters.Name: period_type
parameters.Description: The type of periodic report to include--could be monthly, quarterly or semiannual. The value includes the type; M for monthly, Q for quarterly, and S for semiannually and the period number; so a second quarter report would be Q2 and a monthly report covering August would be M8. Using this option will only return periodic reports.

parameters.Name: year_covered
parameters.Description: The calendar year that a periodic report covers. Non-periodic reports that do not cover a particular time period will be excluded.

parameters.Name: time_range
parameters.Description: Only show reports received within one of the following time ranges: today, in the last seven days, or at any time in this cycle.

parameters.Name: report_type
parameters.Description: The type of report to include

parameters.Name: is_superceded
parameters.Description: When an amended version of an older filing is received we consider the original to have been superseded. When set to false, show only the most recent versions of an electronic filing; when set to True, show only original filings which have since been amended.

methods.Synopsis: Return information about independent expenditures reported to the FEC. Independent expenditures are campaign spending by outside groups that are not made in coordination with the candidate, but support or oppose someone running for office. They must be reported within 24 or 48 hours. Any domestic entity can make an independent expenditure in any amount they want, including corporations, unions and nonprofits.

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. Default is json.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return. Default is 1.

parameters.Name: page_size
parameters.Description: The number of page results to return. for json, the default is 100 and the maximum is 100. This parameter is ignored for csv downloads, which return all matching rows, with a limit of 2000 total rows returned.

parameters.Name: support_oppose_checked
parameters.Description: Whether the expenditures supports (S) or opposes (O) a candidate.

parameters.Name: min_spent
parameters.Description: The minimum money spent on an independent expenditure.

parameters.Name: filer_committee_id_number
parameters.Description: The FEC id of the committee making the expenditure. This is a nine-character code that begins with 'C'.

parameters.Name: candidate_id_checked
parameters.Description: The FEC id of the candidate targeted (either supported or opposed) by the independent expenditure. This is a nine-character code that begins with 'H', 'S', or 'P'.

parameters.Name: district_checked
parameters.Description: The internal id of the district the candidate is running in. The id can be determined by using the /districts/ endpoint.

parameters.Name: candidate_state_checked
parameters.Description: The two-digit postal code of the state in which the candidate targeted is running, e.g. 'NC' or 'OK'

parameters.Name: candidate_office_checked
parameters.Description: A one-digit code for the office the candidate targeted by the expenditure is seeking: 'H' for House or 'S' for Senate.

parameters.Name: candidate_district_checked
parameters.Description: A two digit code showing the district number of house candidates only. The first district would be '01'. States with at-large house districts, e.g. North Dakota, are assigned '00'. This number is not reliably assigned to senate districts; sometimes a '00' is used, sometimes the value is null

parameters.Name: candidate_party_checked
parameters.Description: A one digit code representing the party of the candidate targeted by the expenditure: 'D' for Democrat and 'R' for Republican. This value is often missing for third party candidates.

methods.Synopsis: Summarize total spending by congressional district, including candidate spending and independent expenditures. Electioneering and 'communication cost' (promotion of candidates to members of a corporation or assocation) is not included. Also useful for retrieving IDs.

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. Default is json.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return. Default is 1.

parameters.Name: page_size
parameters.Description: The number of page results to return. for json, the default is 100 and the maximum is 100. This parameter is ignored for csv downloads, which return all matching rows, with a limit of 2000 total rows returned.

parameters.Name: state
parameters.Description: The two-letter postal code for the state where the district is located, e.g. 'AK' or 'DE'.

parameters.Name: office
parameters.Description: A one-digit code for the district's office: 'H' for House or 'S' for Senate.

parameters.Name: office_district
parameters.Description: A two digit code showing the district number of house districts only. The first district would be '01'. States with at-large house districts, e.g. North Dakota, are assigned '00'. This number is not reliably assigned to senate districts; sometimes a '00' is used, sometimes the value is null

parameters.Name: term_class
parameters.Description: The term class used to describe Senate seats' election cycle. Term class 1 is up in 2018, 2 is up in 2014 and 3 is up in 2016. This value is null for house districts.

parameters.Name: incumbent_party
parameters.Description: A one letter code for the incumbent's political party: 'D' for Democrat and 'R' for Republican. Angus King, independent Senator of Maine, is listed as 'I'

methods.Synopsis: Return information about candidates for federal office

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. Default is json.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return. Default is 1.

parameters.Name: page_size
parameters.Description: The number of page results to return. for json, the default is 100 and the maximum is 100. This parameter is ignored for csv downloads, which return all matching rows, with a limit of 2000 total rows returned.

parameters.Name: fec_id
parameters.Description: The FEC id of the candidate by the independent expenditure. This is a nine-character code that begins with 'H', 'S', or 'P'.

parameters.Name: state
parameters.Description: The two-letter postal code for the state where the candidate is running, e.g. 'AK' or 'DE'.

parameters.Name: office
parameters.Description: A one-digit code for the candidate's office: 'H' for House or 'S' for Senate.

parameters.Name: office_district
parameters.Description: A two digit code showing the district number of house districts only. The first district would be '01'. States with at-large house districts, e.g. North Dakota, are assigned '00'. This number is not reliably assigned to senate districts; sometimes a '00' is used, sometimes the value is null

parameters.Name: term_class
parameters.Description: The term class used to describe Senate seats' election cycle. Term class 1 is up in 2018, 2 is up in 2014 and 3 is up in 2016. This value is null for house districts.

parameters.Name: district
parameters.Description: An internal district id. Can be retrieved from the districts endpoint.

parameters.Name: party
parameters.Description: A one letter code for the incumbent's political party: 'D' for Democrat and 'R' for Republican. Angus King, independent Senator of Maine, is listed as 'I'. This value is often missing for third party candidates.

parameters.Name: is_incumbent
parameters.Description: Is the candidate an incumbent?

methods.Synopsis: Return summary information about a nonprofit that reports spending to the FEC or a PAC, including candidate committees, leadership PACs, joint fundraising committees, super PACs, hybrid super PACs party committees, corporate pacs, etc

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. Default is json.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return. Default is 1.

parameters.Name: page_size
parameters.Description: The number of page results to return. for json, the default is 100 and the maximum is 100. This parameter is ignored for csv downloads, which return all matching rows, with a limit of 2000 total rows returned.

parameters.Name: ctype
parameters.Description: The FEC committee type. See more about committee types at the top of the page.

parameters.Name: fec_id
parameters.Description: The FEC id of the committee by the independent expenditure. This is a nine-character code that begins with 'C'.

parameters.Name: min_raised
parameters.Description: The minimum amount reported as having been raised by the committee during the 2014 cycle.

parameters.Name: min_spent
parameters.Description: The minimum amount reported as having been spent by the committee during the 2014 cycle.

parameters.Name: min_coh
parameters.Description: The minimum cash on hand reported in the committee's most recent periodic filing.

methods.Synopsis: Return summary information about any outside spending group, including non-committees (which are typically nonprofits, but may include individuals, LLC's, corporations or unions)

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: The format of the returned data. Default is json.

parameters.Name: page
parameters.Description: The page number of results to return. Default is 1.

parameters.Name: page_size
parameters.Description: The number of page results to return. for json, the default is 100 and the maximum is 100. This parameter is ignored for csv downloads, which return all matching rows, with a limit of 2000 total rows returned.

parameters.Name: ctype
parameters.Description: The FEC committee type. See more about committee types at the top of the page. Note that only some committee types are permitted to make independent expenditures.

parameters.Name: fec_id
parameters.Description: The FEC id of the committee by the independent expenditure. This is a nine-character code that begins with 'C'.

parameters.Name: min_ies
parameters.Description: The minimum amount reported as having been spent by the committee on independent expenditures during the 2014 cycle.
